column4: Whats the default folder where background images for gnome are stored?
Is that what it's called on your system? The folder's called wallpapers for me, but ymmv.
yep, its called backgrounds for me, no wallpaper
anyways, when i try to copy images, it says i cant
Pastebin your exact commands and their output, please.
anyway i can copy commands from tty2?
Then why are you on tty2?
Well yeah, you're trying to copy without using sudo.
so i then did sudo, and it was, weird
And what does the command "file /usr/share/backgrounds/Machinae-Supremacy-Orange.png" say?
There you go ;) sudo chmod 700 /usr/share/backgrounds/* && name=`whoami` && sudo chown ${name}:${name} /usr/share/backgrounds/*
